repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Library

did.abstract: The collection contain administrative records, clippings, correspondence, ephemera, galley proofs, and financial records of Camille Forman, dating from 1900 to 2002.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

acqinfo.head: Provenance and Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records were donated by Ms. Forman in 2003.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Camille Lavieri Forman was born in Hartford, ConOctober 10, 1933. She graduated from Weaver High School in Hartford in 1951 and received a BA from the University of Connecticut in 1955. On January 26, 1957, she married UConn Art professor Ken Forman. In 1968, she received an MLS degree from the University of Rhode Island. She was employed as a librarian at the University of Connecticut Libraries until 1991. Beginning in the early 1970s Forman began creating fiber art and exhibiting it. In addition to her individual work, She has collaborated on a number of pieces with her husband.

After retiring from the University of Connecticut Libraries in the early 1990s she and her husband traveled regularly to France, often living in Paris and Provence for several months each year. In 1998, Camille was disabled by a stroke. During her recovery she turned to watercolor painting and writing. In 2001, Camille published her memoir, A Perfect Time for Butterflies.
For more information about Camille and Ken Forman see, A Perfect Time for Butterflies.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Camille Forman Papers. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains administrative records, clippings, correspondence, ephemera, galley proofs, and financial records of Camille Forman and her family. The records encompass the period of 1900 to 2002, and includes numerous documents related to her and her husband's family.

The collection contains materials related to various people and institutions, correspondence between family members in the United States and those abroad; family histories for Camille and Ken Forman; materials related to Forman's achievements as a handicapped stroke-survivor; marriage announcement in the Hartford Courant;The American Thread Company; Willimantic Mills; Windham Regional Arts Council; biographical material for Camille Forman; materials pertaining to Forman's publication, A Perfect Time for Butterflies; materials pertaining to immigration and passports; family military service; American Express Company; American Railway Express Company; Cunard Line; Phoenix State Bank and Trust Company; White Star Line; Western Union telegrams; The City Bank & Trust Company; stamps from Italy; and The Union Trust Company.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated materials
